question: Which of the following best define an open-funded mutual fund?
option1: It has an option to invest in any kind of security.
option2: It has units available for sale and repurchase at all times.
option3: It does not have a NAV.
answer: It has units available for sale and repurchase at all times.
explanation: Open-end fund is a fund that can issue and redeem shares at any time. An investor purchase shares in this fund directly from the fund itself, rather than from the existing shareholders.
